td.content: s:patient presents with mild epigastric pain. she is having symptoms 13 x week, in spite of treatment. she is a f retired aged 68 years. o:Height 60 in, Weight 126 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = mild tenderness to deep palpitation a:Ulcers p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed NEXIUM - 40 mg daily, and ordered Urea breath test.

s:70 yr old white female retired c/o 7 days h/o severe diarrhea. NKDA. she denies drinking alcohol Denies ever using tobacco o:Height 61 in, Weight 131 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = mild epigastric tenderness, no rebound tenderness a:Ulcers p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to gastroenterology.

td.content: s:patient describes recurrent severe abdominal pain over the past month. The patient reports severe epigastric pain, severe diarrhea, Stomach. patient is a white f aged 70 years.
